Directories Nadim Alkharouf Contact Info Phone: 410-704-3149 Office: SC 5101A Email: nalkharouf@towson.edu https://www.linkedin.com/pub/nadim-alkharouf/b/550/94b https://wp.towson.edu/nalkharo/ Education Ph.D. Computational Sciences and Informatics, George Mason University, VA. May 2004 			M.S. Biological Sciences, Yarmouk University, Irbid, Jordan. August 1998 			B.Sc. Biological Sciences, Yarmouk University, Irbid, Jordan. June 1996 Areas of Expertise Bioinformatics, Analysis of high throughout experiments (next generation sequencing, Illumina and 454), Database design and development, Data mining, Web development. Research: Dr. Alkharoufâs area of research is computational biology\Bioinformatics. His lab works on the design and development of databases for high throughput biological experiments. His lab also works on the analysis of data from genome sequencing projects, gene expression and proteomics experiments. Dr. Alkharouf is also very interested in data mining and web development. Example projects in his lab include building a database and analyzing gene expression data (Microarry and RNA-Seq) from experiments on soybean, dealing with the identification of resistance genes in soybean against devastating parasites and fungal infections. And working with strawberry genomic data (Illumina RNA-Seq) to elucidate the molecular function of flower and fruit development in strawberry. His lab has also assembled and re-annotated a number of genomes, the most recent was the complete re-annotation of the strawberry genome. Service: Member of the FSCM Undergraduate Research Committee (2006 â present) Member of the FSCM STEM committee (2013-present) Member of the MB3 Committee (2006 â present) Member of the CS Curriculum Committee (2012 â present) Member of the FCSM College Council Executive Committee (recording secretary) (2012-2013) Member of the FCSM College Council (2010-2013) Member of the CS Graduate Committee (2009 â 2014) Member of a number of Faculty Hiring Committees in MB3 and AIT Direct Edit JS for Moving Direct Edit Button into place.
